titleStmt.title: James W. Tate to M. R. Harden
CWG9107

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
OFFICE SECRETARY OF STATE,
Frankfort, July 16th, 1862.
Dear Sir:
I herewith Send you Craycrofts remission of forfeited recognizance the amount is not stated you can fill that up and drop me a line as to the amount also his first name which is not Stated

Very Truly Yours
Jas W Tate
Asst. Secy

M. R. Harden Esq
Springfield Ill

Dear Sir -- Thomas Craycraft is the name & $1000 -- the amount judgment It was as shown in his petition he handed the Gov whom of Frankfort & I suppose may not have been filed -- Mr Chasing prepare hand boy the Sherriff the remission sent for of miscarriage by mail -- If it is important he will
return it when the more one is recd -- which please send him
